BR_text.BRdescription:
Hello! I ran a example code: examples/torch/pearl_ml1_push.py and got a log data.
 Then I wrote a resume code like this:
 <denchmark-code>def` resume_task(snapshot_config, *_):
     runner = LocalRunner(snapshot_config=snapshot_config)
     runner.restore(from_dir='dir')
     runner.resume()
 
 run_experiment(
     resume_task,
     log_dir='dir',
     snapshot_mode='last',
     seed=1,
 )
 </denchmark-code>
 
 but this doesn't work. The errors are the following:
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36123202/79548676-bff0be80-80d0-11ea-8c2e-a655dc8b461d.png></denchmark-link>
 
 How can I fix this problem?

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HyeongYeolRyu>@HyeongYeolRyu</denchmark-link>
  Thanks for your report. I checked and found that Pearl does not properly implement resuming. I will make a fix, hopefully by the end of today.
